perturbation.original_text: 11.3 Cure Period. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any Event of Default will not be deemed to have occurred until fifteen (15) days after the non-defaulting party has provided the defaulting party with written notice specifying the Event of Default and such Event of Default remains uncured.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.3 Cure Period. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any Event of Default will be deemed to have occurred immediately after the non-defaulting party has provided the defaulting party with written notice specifying the Event of Default. There will be no cure period.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows a 15-day cure period for an Event of Default. By removing the cure period and stating that the Event of Default occurs immediately, the modified clause creates a contradiction with standard legal practices which typically mandate a reasonable opportunity to cure a breach before termination of a contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles regarding 'Reasonable Opportunity to Cure' before contract termination. Many states have laws and precedents requiring a chance to remedy a breach.

perturbation.original_text: 18. Notices. Any notice pursuant to this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered on the date of personal delivery or confirmed delivery by a nationally-recognized overnight courier service, or on the third day after prepaid mailing by certified U.S. mail, return receipt requested, and shall be addressed as follows (or to such other address as any party may request by written notice):
perturbation.changed_text: 18. Notices. Any notice pursuant to this Agreement may be delivered via telepathy, direct mental link, or smoke signals. Such methods shall constitute adequate notice, and no other means of communication are necessary or permissible.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a clear legal contradiction by specifying methods of notice (telepathy, direct mental link, or smoke signals) that are not legally recognized or enforceable. Legal notice requires verifiable and documented delivery methods. This clause conflicts with standard contract law requirements for providing legally sufficient notice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles regarding 'Legal Notice' and 'Adequate Delivery Methods.' The clause violates the requirement for verifiable and documented delivery methods.

perturbation.original_text: 16. Construction. This Agreement will be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Indiana without regard to principles of conflicts of laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 16. Construction. This Agreement will be construed in accordance with the Laws of the Moon.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that the contract will be construed under Indiana law, which is a recognized legal jurisdiction. Changing this to "Laws of the Moon" creates a direct conflict with established legal principles, as there is no legal system or recognized body of law associated with the moon that a court could apply. This would make the contract unenforceable due to uncertainty and lack of a proper governing law clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles regarding 'Choice of Law' and requirement for a defined and recognized legal jurisdiction.
